But he does not deserve any special monetary awards.

And you are going to pay me a grand total of 43 cents for this?
OK, the fact that there is no record of of the Appliance Store doing the tv installation, plus the fact that the tv stayed in place for months before falling, tells me that the store cannot be held responsible for the tv falling.
Reimburse the drunken gambler ("Bar Customer") for his ER visit and send him on his way. I don't have any patience for people who try to game the system by pretending to be injured.

Title: Answer a Survey About a Court Case Settlement

Answer.facts:
I chose only half responsibility because I don't have enough information to go on, The explanation said that there was no documentation of the appliance store installing the TV. This is a very big deal to me when we're discussing liability. 

Even if the plaintiff was injured before. He could be more easily injured again by such a random chance of something happening like a TV falling on him. Deciding to catch it or duck is a split second fight or flight response, I can't really hold him too responsible for it though it was a bad move in retrospect if he already has spinal issues. 

I awarded him the money for his medical expenses because of the bar or appliance installers negligence, his past history doesn't come into question here.

Answer.facts: If Appliance Store is indeed responsible for the mounting of the TV and proof can be shown that it was indeed the mounting that caused the TV to fall, then they are responsible for the resulting damages.  However, they are not responsible for injuries that happened to Bar Customer outside of said accident.  Thus, they would then be held accountable for the "questionable hairline fracture of the arm."  The resulting ER visit, X-Rays, and medical needs necessary to remedy the arm is what Appliance Store would be held accountable for which in estimation should be roughly $3,000.  They are not to be held responsible for pre-existing conditions that were not a direct result of the accident itself.
